Head: Head
Cervicogenic headache is thought to be a: Cervicogenic headache is thought to be a referred pain from irritation to neck structures (joints and soft tissues) innervated by C1-3 spinal nerves.
What are the common clinical features?: What are the common clinical features?
Headache is one-sided without a side shi: Headache is one-sided without a side shift with pain in the neck, shoulder, or arm on the same side.
Pain is worse with suboptimal posture an: Pain is worse with suboptimal posture and movement of the head and neck.
Treatment and management: reduce pain wi: Physical therapy: reduce pain with manual therapy, massage therapy, acupuncture therapy, cupping therapy, or electrotherapy.
Exercises: range of motion, stretches, a: Exercises: range of motion, stretches, and strengthening exercises.
From incident (whiplash): might involve: From accident (whiplash): might involve muscle strain, ligament sprain, or fracture.
From overuse: might involve sustained po: From overuse: might involve sustained postures from daily tasks (home or work) or poor sleep postures causing tissue overloading.
Contributing factors (poor quality of sl: Contributing factors (poor quality of sleep and bad mood, and so on) might amplify your pain experience.
Assessment: your physiotherapist will do: Assessment: your physiotherapist will do thorough assessments based on guidelines.
Investigation: might require an X-ray fo: Investigation: Depending on the assessment results, an X-ray of the neck may be required.
Treatment: relieve pain and associated s: Treatment: relieve pain and associated symptoms with manual therapy.
Exercises: improve muscle performance (s: Exercises: improve muscle performance (strength and control) and address other injuries.
Treatment and management: relieve pain a: Physical therapy: use acupuncture, manual therapy, massage therapy, electrotherapy, cupping therapy, or kinesiology Patches and taping techniques relieve pain and associated symptoms.
Exercises: improve neck range of motion: Exercises: Improve neck range of motion and muscle performance.
Pain might be from irritation to interve: Pain may be Stimulation of the intervertebral discs, rib joints, Z joints, or back muscles in the mid-back due to accidents, repetitive strain injuries, or prolonged posture during everyday activities (household or work).
How to manage mid back pain?: How to manage mid back pain?
Treatment and management: reduce pain an: Physical therapy: reduce pain and stiffness with manual therapy, massage therapy, or cupping therapy.
Exercises: range of motion, stretches, a: Exercises: range of motion, stretches, and strengthening exercises.
From incident: might involve muscle stra: From accident: might involve muscle strain, ligament sprain, or fracture.
From overuse: might involve repetitive m: From overuse: might involve repetitive movements or sustained postures from daily tasks (home or work) causing tissue overloading.
Contributing factors (poor quality of sl: Contributing factors (poor quality of sleep and bad mood, and so on) might amplify your pain experience.
How to manage low back pain?: How to improve low back pain?
Treatment and management: reduce pain wi: Physical therapy: use manual therapy, massage therapy, acupuncture treatment, kinesiology tape and taping technology, Cupping therapy or electrotherapy for pain relief.
Exercises: range of motion, stretches, a: Exercises: range of motion, stretches, and strengthening exercises.
Sciantica Refers and Inflammation that A: Sciatica is caused by inflammation of the sciatic nerve, which runs from the lower back down to the leg. Inflammation of the sciatic nerve can come from a herniated disc or from a hip muscle such as a pear Tightening of the sciatica muscle (piriformis syndrome). Sciatica may be accompanied by tingling, numbness, tingling, or weakness in the lower extremity.
Treatment and management: reduce pain wi: Physical therapy: reduce pain with manual therapy, massage therapy, acupuncture therapy, cupping therapy, or electrotherapy.
Exercises: range of motion, stretches, a: Exercises: range of motion, stretches, and strengthening exercises.
What structures are involved in shoulder: What structures are involved in shoulder pain?
Joint related (frozen shoulder/labral te: Shoulder joint related (frozen shoulder/labral tear/ACJ sprain).
Deload: avoid or modify activities that: Deload: avoid or modify activities that aggravate symptoms.
Taping: tapping might be used to reduce: Kinesiology Taping and Taping Technology: Kinesiology Taping can be used to reduce shoulder sensitivity and pain.
Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used t: Acupuncture: Acupuncture might be used to release trigger points and provide short-term pain relief.
Manual therapy: soft and deep tissue rel: Manual therapy: soft and deep tissue release, joint mobilization, or stretching might be used to reduce pain and muscle tightness, and improve range of motion.
Shockwave therapy: reduce tissue tightne: Shockwave therapy: reduce tissue tightness around the shoulder and promote tissue repair.
Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound m: Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound might be used to reduce pain and inflammation.
Range of motion exercises: Range of moti: Range of motion exercises: Range of motion exercises help to improve shoulder mobility and prevent stiffness.
Strengthening exercises: Strengthening e: Strengthening exercises: Strengthening exercises for rotator cuffs and muscles around the shoulder blade can improve shoulder biomechanics and reduce pain.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause elbow pain?
Tennis elbow: it involves extensor muscl: Tennis Elbow: Involves the extensor muscles of the forearm. This is common in tennis players, but not limited to other players (such as squash and badminton) or non-athletic people. The main cause of tennis elbow is overuse.
Golfer's elbow: it involves flexor muscl: Golfer's elbow: involves the flexor muscles of the forearm. It is common in golfers, but not limited to other players. The leading cause of golfer's elbow is overuse.
Deload: avoid or modify activities that: Deload: avoid or modify activities that aggravate symptoms. Sometimes, elbow brace might be suggested to relieve symptoms.
Taping: tapping might be used to reduce: Kinesiology Taping and Taping Technology: Kinesiology Taping can be used to reduce elbow sensitivity and pain.
Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used t: Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used to release trigger points, reduce muscle tightness, and restore muscle function.
Manual therapy: soft and deep tissue rel: Manual therapy: soft and deep tissue release, or joint mobilization might be used to reduce pain and improve range of motion.
Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound o: Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound or interferential therapy might be used to reduce pain and inflammation.
Exercises:: Electrotherapy: Ultrasound therapy or disruptive wave therapy can be used to reduce pain and inflammation.
Range of motion exercises: Range of moti: Range of motion exercises: Range of motion exercises help to improve elbow and wrist mobility and prevent stiffness.
Strengthening exercises: Strengthening e: Strengthening exercises for upper limbs can improve muscle performance.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause wrist pain?
Carpal tunnel syndrome: the median nerve: Carpal tunnel syndrome: when the median nerve passes through the carpal tunnel Compression. Common features are burning pain in wrist with numbness of first to third fingers.
Splinting and tapping: maintain wrist in: Kinesiology taping and taping technique: maintain the wrist in a neutral position to avoid compression to the median nerve. Sometimes it may be recommended to use Wrist braces for symptom relief.
Electrotherapy: might be helpful to redu: Electrotherapy: might be helpful to reduce pain, swelling, and inflammation.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause thumb pain?
Mother's thumb: also called De Quervain': Mother's hand: also known as stenosy tenosynovitis, affecting thumb abduction Synovium of the longus and extensor hallux brevis muscles. This causes pain, swelling, and inflammation.
Deload: avoid or modify activities that: Deload: avoid or modify activities that aggravate symptoms. Sometimes, thumb brace might be suggested to relieve symptoms.
Taping: tapping might be used to reduce: Kinesiology Taping and Taping Technology: Kinesiology Taping can be used to reduce thumb sensitivity and pain.
Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used t: Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used to release trigger points, reduce muscle tightness, and restore muscle function.
Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound o: Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound or interferential therapy might be used to reduce pain and inflammation.
Range of motion exercises: Range of moti: Range of motion exercises: Range of motion exercises help to improve thumb and wrist mobility and prevent stiffness.
Strengthening exercises: Strengthening e: Strengthening exercises: Strengthening exercises for upper limbs can improve muscle performance.
What structures are involved in pelvic g: What structures are involved in pelvic girdle pain?
The structures that are commonly involve: The structures that are commonly involved are sacroiliac joint, symphysis pubis and the surrounding ligaments and muscles.
How to manage PGP?: How to improve pelvic girdle pain?
A biopsychosocial model will be used to: A biopsychosocial model will be used to guide treatment and management.
Reduce pain with massage therapy, acupun: Reduce pain with massage therapy, acupuncture, taping, cupping therapy, or electrotherapy.
Stretches, strengthening, and relaxation: Perform stretching, strengthening, and relaxation exercises.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause hip pain?
Hip osteoarthritis: degenerative conditi: Hip osteoarthritis: This is a degenerative condition that affects the hip joint. Cushion The cartilage in the joint is worn away, causing inflammation, pain and stiffness.
Reduce pain with manual therapy and hydr: Reduce pain with manual therapy and hydrotherapy.
Exercises are key in managing hip osteoa: Movement is to improve hip bone Key for arthritis. This includes hip mobility exercises, hip muscle strengthening exercises (deep hip stabilizers, gluteus maximus and medius, lower body and trunk), as well as balance and proprioception.
Type 1 hamstring strain: sprinting-relat: Type 1 hamstring strain: associated with high speed running.
Type 2 hamstring strain: stretch-related: Type 2 hamstring strain: stretch-related injury that is commonly seen in dancers and gymnasts.
How to manage posterior thigh pain?: How to manage posterior thigh pain?
PEACE & LOVE principle will be used to m: PEACE & LOVE principle will be used to manage hamstring strain.
Elevate the injured limb to reduce swell: Elevate the injured limb to reduce swelling.
Compress with tapping or bandages to red: Compress with taping or bandages to reduce swelling.
Educate the benefits of active approach: Educate the benefits of active approach to recovery.
Load with gentle movement and exercises.
Exercises to improve mobility, strength,: Exercises to improve mobility, strength, and flexibility.
In addition to acute soft tissue managem: In addition to acute soft tissue management described above, Physical therapy (acupuncture therapy, electrotherapy, massage therapy, or cupping therapy) and exercise therapy (strengthening exercises) should be initiated as early as possible to facilitate recovery.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause knee pain?
Knee osteoarthritis: often called “wear: Knee osteoarthritis: often called “wear and tear” arthritis. People with knee osteoarthritis often experience pain and stiffness that can affect their mobility.
Patellofemoral pain syndrome: The patell: Patellofemoral pain syndrome: The patellofemoral joint is the junction between the kneecap and the trochlea of the femur. Patellofemoral joint pain occurs when the patellofemoral joint is overloaded. Patellofemoral joint pain is often associated with activities that load the patellofemoral joint related to, for example, walking stairs, squatting, and running.
Reduce pain with manual therapy and hydr: Reduce pain with manual therapy and hydrotherapy.
Exercises are key in managing knee osteo: Exercises are key in managing knee osteoarthritis. These include range of motion and strengthening exercises (quadriceps, hamstring, and gluteus). quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes).
Reduce pain with manual therapy and tapp: Reduce pain with manual therapy and taping techniques.
Exercises are key in managing patellofem: Motion is the key to improving patellofemoral pain syndrome .Includes joint mobility exercises, strengthening exercises (quadriceps, hip muscles, lower body and trunk muscles), and balance and coordination exercises.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause posterior leg pain?
Gastrocnemius and soleus strain: both ar: Gastrocnemius and soleus strain: both are common causes of posterior leg pain. It occurs when the muscles are overstretched with speed.
How to manage posterior leg pain?: How to manage posterior leg pain?
PEACE & LOVE principle will be used to m: Use the PEACE & LOVE principle to manage calf strain.
Elevate the injured limb to reduce swell: Elevate the injured limb to reduce swelling.
Compress with tapping or bandages to red: Compress with taping or bandages to reduce swelling.
Educate the benefits of active approach: Educate the benefits of active approach to recovery.
Load with gentle movement and exercises.
Exercises to improve mobility, strength,: Exercises to improve mobility, strength, and flexibility.
In addition to acute soft tissue managem: In addition to the above acute soft tissue management , physical therapy (acupuncture therapy, electrotherapy, massage therapy, or cupping therapy) and exercise therapy (strengthening exercises) should be initiated as early as possible to facilitate recovery.
Medial tibial stress syndrome (shin spli: Inner tibial stress syndrome (shin osteitis): Shin osteitis is a common cause of pain on the inner side of the leg due to overuse. People with shin ostiitis experience sporadic pain on the inner side of the tibia. The long toe flexor muscle is believed to be the source of the pain.
How to manage medial leg pain?: How to improve medial leg pain?
Deload: avoid or modify activities that: Deload: avoid or modify activities that aggravate symptoms. Sometimes, poor footwear might be one of the contributing factors to overloading muscles.
Taping: tapping might be used to reduce: Taping: tapping might be used to reduce pain and offload sensitive structures around the leg.
Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used t: Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used to release trigger points, reduce muscle tightness, and restore muscle function.
Manual therapy: soft and deep tissue rel: Manual therapy: soft and deep tissue release, or joint mobilization might be used to reduce pain and improve range of motion.
Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound o: Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound or interferential therapy might be used to reduce pain and inflammation.
Range of motion exercises: Range of moti: Range of motion exercises: Range of motion exercises help to improve ankle and foot mobility and prevent stiffness.
Strengthening exercises: Strengthening e: Strengthening exercises: Strengthening exercises for lower limbs can improve muscle performance.
Midportion and insertional achilles tend: Non-insert (midportion) and insertion (insertional) Achilles tendinopathy: the Achilles tendon is the junction of the gastrocnemius and soleus muscles. People with Achilles tendinopathy experience gradual pain in the middle or bottom of the Achilles tendon. Achilles tendinopathy can be caused by overloading the Achilles tendon. This can happen from a single event (reactive), or gradually over time. Formation (degenerate).
How to manage achilles pain: How to improve Achilles tendon pain?
Deload: avoid or modify activities that: Deload: avoid or modify activities that aggravate symptoms. Shoe inserts might be used to reduce pain and offload achilles tendon.
Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used t: Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used to release trigger points, reduce muscle tightness, and restore muscle function.
Manual therapy: soft and deep tissue rel: Manual therapy: soft and deep tissue release, or joint mobilization might be used to reduce pain and improve range of motion.
Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound o: Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound or interferential therapy might be used to reduce pain and inflammation.
Range of motion exercises: Range of moti: Range of motion exercises: Range of motion exercises help to improve ankle mobility and prevent stiffness.
Strengthening exercises: Strengthening e: Strengthening exercises: Strengthening exercises (isometric, isotonic, plyometric) for lower limbs can improve muscle performance.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause ankle pain?
Ankle sprain: Ankle joint is stabilized: Ankle sprain: Ankle joint is stabilized with its specific bone arrangement and the surrounding ligaments. Ligaments are tough bands of tissue that support and hold joints together. When you overstretch or tear one of these ligaments, this results in a sprained ankle.
PEACE & LOVE principle will be used to m: PEACE & LOVE principle will be used to manage an ankle sprain.
Elevate the injured limb to reduce swell: Elevate the injured limb to reduce swelling.
Compress with tapping or bandages to red: Compress with taping or bandages to reduce swelling.
Educate the benefits of active approach: Educate the benefits of active approach to recovery.
Load with gentle movement and exercises.
Exercises to improve mobility, strength,: Exercises to improve mobility, strength, and proprioception.
In addition to acute soft tissue managem: In addition to acute soft tissue management described above, treatment and exercises (range of motion, strengthening, and balance and proprioception exercises) should be commenced as soon as possible to optimize tissue healing.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause foot pain?
Plantar fasciitis: develops when the con: Plantar fasciitis: develops when the connective tissue (plantar fascia), which supports the arch of the foot, is irritated as a result of being overused, overstretched, or direct pressure.
Deload: avoid or modify activities that: Deload: avoid or modify activities that aggravate symptoms. Sometimes, customized and prefabricated foot orthoses might be used to relieve symptoms.
Taping: low dye taping to support planta: Taping: low dye taping to support plantar fascia.
Acupuncture: reduce muscle tightness in: Acupuncture: reduce muscle tightness in lower limbs.
Massage therapy: reduce tension in plant: Massage therapy: reduce tension in plantar fascia and proximal myofascial regions (calf/hamstrings/glutes).
Manual therapy: reduce joint stiffness a: Manual therapy: reduce joint stiffness around the foot.
Exercises: stretches (plantar fascia/cal: Exercises: stretches (plantar fascia/calf) and strengthening exercises (lower limbs and foot intrinsics).
